title: FIFA 2026 World Cup Qualifiers: What Sri Lankan Fans Need to Know
byline: With the 2026 FIFA World Cup fast approaching, the qualification picture is becoming clearer as nations across every continent scramble for their place at the expanded 48-team tournament. Co-hosted by the USA, Canada and Mexico, the competition will feature more teams than ever before — and as of now, 32 countries have already sealed their spots.

title: Pakistan Begin T20I Tri-Series Tonight vs Zimbabwe in Rawalpindi
byline: Hosts open week-long event as Sri Lanka await; Nissanka nears major milestone.

title: Industry warns of productivity fallout from 2026 estate wage hike
byline: The government’s latest decision to raise the plantation workers’ wages has been made without any consultations with the industry personnel, a senior representative of the plantation sector said while asserting the move could impact the output.

title: Elderly cinnamon peeler falls into honeytrap, stripped of valuables by drug-addict couple
byline: A 58-year-old elderly man from the Nikaweratiya area employed as a cinnamon peeler in Hakmana, who met a 22-year-old young woman at Galle and had a casual talk and soon fell in love with her. The onlookers might have presumed that they were father and daughter.

title: SriLankan Airlines wins best food and beverage award at 2026 APEX awards
byline: SriLankan Airlines has been recognized for excellence in its in-flight dining, winning the Best in Food and Beverage award for the Central/South Asia region at the 2026 APEX Awards.

title: Sluice gates opened at Deduru Oya and Polgolla reservoirs amid heavy rain
byline: The Irrigation Department has announced that two sluice gates of the Deduru Oya Reservoir have been opened due to ongoing heavy rainfall. Each gate was opened by one foot, releasing 1,400 cubic feet of water per second.

title: Men in Sri Lanka have higher suicide rates than women
byline: Men in Sri Lanka continue to suffer from diseases such as depression and anxiety, thus leading to a higher suicide rate, which is 27 per 100,000 males and five per 100,000 females with an overall suicide rate of 15 per 100,000 population, according to the World Health Organisation (WHO).

title: Is Sri Lanka sacrificing its entrepreneurs for short-term gain?
byline: The government’s recent budget, with its well-intentioned promise to build a more equitable society, has brought a familiar refrain: higher taxes on businesses. The new mandate, which subjects every business with a monthly turnover of 3 million LKR to an 18% VAT, is presented as a progressive tool. The objective is noble to fund social programmes and provide a financial lifeline to our most vulnerable citizens.

title: Health authorities warn of Chikungunya spread in Matara
byline: The Health Entomology Officers Association has issued a warning about the ongoing spread of Chikungunya in the Matara area, which has affected both health workers and the general public over the past several months.

title: Couple swept away by flash floods
byline: A married couple was reportedly swept away by flash floods in the Kandepuhulpola area of Boralanda, Welimada, following heavy rains last evening (17).

title: Foreign woman sexually harassed by three-wheeler driver in Kandy; Suspect arrested
byline: Soon after the arrest of a 23-year-old man for exposing himself and attempting to sexually harass a female New Zealand tourist in Thirukkovil, another incident involving the harassment of a foreign woman has been reported in Kandy.

title: Hamas rejects UN Gaza resolution, says international force would become party to conflict
byline: Hamas rejected the United Nations Security Council’s passing a US-drafted resolution endorsing US President Donald Trump’s Gaza plan, saying it fails to meet Palestinians’ rights and demands and seeks to impose an international trusteeship on the enclave that Palestinians and resistance factions oppose.

title: Mihintale chief incumbent blames Government for Trincomalee temple incident
byline: The Chief Incumbent of the Mihintale Raja Maha Viharaya, Venerable Walawahengunawewe Dhammarathana Thera, has strongly criticized the government over the incident at the Bodhiraja Sambuddha Jayanthi Viharaya in Trincomalee, claiming that the warning signs were clear before the current administration came into power.

title: Over 2.28 million Sri Lankans pledge to donate eyes
byline: The Sri Lanka Eye Donation Society (SLEDS) announced that more than 2.28 million Sri Lankans have pledged to donate their eyes after death, marking a major milestone in the nation’s longstanding humanitarian efforts.

title: Supreme Court dismisses FR petition against Cabraal, others
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition filed by Ven. Thiniyawala Palitha Thera seeking an order directing the Attorney General to initiate both criminal and civil proceedings against former State Minister Ajith Nivaard Cabral and several others for allegedly engaging in illegal financial transactions involving public funds, causing losses to the State, was dismissed by the Supreme Court.

title: Chamara Sampath to be indicted before High Court for misappropriation of public funds
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) informed the Colombo Chief Magistrate that the investigation conducted by the CIABOC on the alleged corruption committed by former Badulla District Parliamentarian Chamara Sampath Dassanayake to the tune of Rs. 1 million of public funds belonging to the Uva Provincial Council,

title: Kalutara district to launch comprehensive sex education program for schools
byline: Kalutara District Parliamentarian Nilanthi Kottahachchi, Chairperson of the Children and Women’s Sub-Committee of the Kalutara District Coordinating Committee, announced that a program will be implemented next year to provide sex education to all school children in the district.

title: Kataragama dog control drive records 54 sterilizations, 67 vaccinations
byline: A five-year initiative to control rabies and the stray dog population in the Kataragama area has recorded significant progress, with 54 sterilizations and 67 anti-rabies vaccinations completed during the first four days of the campaign.

title: Train derails at Ohiya, upcountry train services disrupted
byline: A train traveling from Kandy to Badulla at 4:00 a.m. this morning derailed at Ohiya Railway Station.

title: Locally made school shoes to come with one-year warranty
byline: The Ministry of Industrial Development will supply shoes with a one-year warranty, ensuring quality under the supervision of the Sri Lanka Textiles and Garments Institute, as part of a new school voucher program.

title: Govt approves night duty for women in hotels
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved an amendment to the Shop and Office Servants (Regulation of Service and Remuneration) Act, allowing women over 18 years of age working as food and beverage servers in commercial hotels and restaurants to be employed during night hours, after 6 p.m. and before 6 a.m.

title: Cabinet approves Bill to repeal Parliamentary Pensions Act
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted policy approval to repeal the Parliamentary Pensions Act No. 1 of 1971, following a decision taken at the Cabinet meeting.

title: CEB profit plunges to Rs. 3.58 billion in Q3 2025
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has reported a significant drop in its financial performance, with profits for the third quarter of 2025 falling sharply to Rs. 3.58 billion, according to its latest financial statements.

title: 33 Israeli tourism representatives arrive in Sri Lanka for study tour
byline: A delegation of 33 Israeli tourism industry representatives arrived in the country last evening (17) to participate in a 10-day study tour aimed at exploring tourism opportunities across the country.

title: Landslides and rockfalls block key roads in Badulla as heavy rains continue
byline: Continuous heavy rainfall across the Badulla district has triggered multiple landslides and rockfalls, blocking several roads and causing significant property damage, Badulla District Secretary Panduka Sri Prabath Abeywardena said today (18).

title: Sack with suspected narcotics found on Bentota beach
byline: A sack suspected to contain narcotics was found on the shores of the Bentota beach this morning, police said.

title: Gambling Regulatory Authority Act to take effect from December 1
byline: The government has decided to implement the Gambling Regulatory Authority Act from December 1, 2025, following a Gazette notification issued by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Get maximum benefit from Colombo Security Conclave: Ravi K tells government
byline: Sri Lanka should get the maximum benefit from the Colombo Security Conclave, which is a joint programme of several countries in the region, including India, the Maldives and Mauritius.

title: Special cyber crimes division to be set up in police: Minister
byline: A special cyber crimes division is to set up soon within the police, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today.

title: Hamas rejects UN Gaza resolution, says international force would become party to conflict
byline: Hamas rejected the United Nations Security Council’s passing a US-drafted resolution endorsing US President Donald Trump’s Gaza plan, saying it fails to meet Palestinians’ rights and demands and seeks to impose an international trusteeship on the enclave that Palestinians and resistance factions oppose.

title: AWC accuses authorities of inhumane confinement of Monkeys in Thumpane
byline: The Animal Welfare Coalition (AWC) has accused authorities of state-sanctioned animal cruelty in Thumpane, alleging that large groups of monkeys have been kept in cages for days without food or shelter.

title: Plane carrying Congo minister, 20 others bursts into flames; skids off runway
byline: A chartered Embraer ERJ‑145LR carrying Democratic Republic of Congo mines minister Louis Watum Kabamba and around 20 others onboard skidded off the runway and caught fire at Kolwezi Airport on Monday.

title: Google boss warns ’no company is going to be immune’ if AI bubble bursts
byline: Every company would be affected if the AI bubble were to burst, the head of Google’s parent firm Alphabet has told the BBC.

title: Babar Azam fined for breaching ICC Code of Conduct
byline: Pakistan player Babar Azam has been fined 10 per cent of his match fee for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the third ODI against Sri Lanka in Rawalpindi on Sunday.

title: Severe lightning alert issued for multiple districts
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a severe lightning advisory for the North-Western, Western, Southern, and Sabaragamuwa provinces, effective until 11:30 p.m. today.

title: Over 6,700 cybercrime cases reported; 35 involve children
byline: Over 6,700 cybercrime incidents have been reported in Sri Lanka over the past eleven months, the Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT) said.

title: Special committee to be appointed for restructuring tri-forces: Deputy Minister
byline: A special committee will be appointed next year for the restructuring of the tri-forces, Deputy Minister of Defence Major General (Rtd) Aruna Jayasekara said today.

title: Dr. K. Waligepolage appointed Director General of Irrigation
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the appointment of Dr. (Eng.) K. Waligepolage as the new Director General of Irrigation, effective 4 December 2025.

title: Indian Consul General visits former President Mahinda Rajapaksa on his birthday
byline: On the occasion of his birthday, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa received a visit from Indian Consul General Sri Harvinder Singh at his Carlton residence in Tangalle today (18).

title: “Sri Lanka has enormous promise, but effective tourism promotion requires both investment and continuous effort”  - Zubin Karkaria, Founder & CEO, VFS Global Group
byline: Over a year after the e-visa system handled by the consortium—comprising IVS-GBS as the primary partner and VFS Global as the technical partner—was suspended in Sri Lanka, Daily Mirror Editor-in-Chief Jamila Husain interviewed Zubin Karkaria, Founder and Chief Executive Officer of VFS Global Group,

title: Sri Lanka signs debt restructuring agreement with Denmark
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has signed a bilateral agreement with the Government of Denmark as part of the ongoing External Debt Restructuring Process.

title: Sri Lankan pilgrims can now use UPI in India
byline: A pilot initiative to introduce UPI One World digital service for Sri Lankan Buddhist pilgrims visiting India has been launched.

title: Veteran radio presenter Chitra Kumari Kalubowila passes away
byline: Award-winning radio presenter Chitra Kumari Kalubowila has passed away, leaving behind a remarkable legacy in Sri Lanka’s broadcasting industry.

title: Kataragama dog control drive records 223 sterilizations, 251 vaccinations
byline: A five-year initiative to control rabies and the stray dog population in the Kataragama area has recorded significant progress, with 223 sterilizations and 251 anti-rabies vaccinations completed during the first four days of the campaign.

title: Medical specialists meet President, express frustration over solutions
byline: Representatives of the Association of Medical Specialists (AMS) met President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today to discuss a series of long-standing issues affecting medical specialists.

title: Defence Ministry expenditure head approved
byline: The Defence Ministry’s expenditure head was approved today by a majority of 92 votes, with 101 MPs voting in favor, while 9 MPs representing Tamil parties from the North and East voted against it.

title: Shooting in Tangalle Kills Couple
byline: A 68-year-old man and his 59-year-old wife were shot dead in Tangalle this evening, in a brazen attack that has shocked residents of the coastal town.

title: Market pullback deepens as selling resumes
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange witnessed another weak trading session on Tuesday (18th November 2025), with the ASPI declining 172.02 points (-0.72%) to close at 23,051.66, extending its pullback from the all-time high of 23,769.5. Market sentiment remained cautious as investors continued to lock in profits, while selective buying emerged in fundamentally strong counters amid the broader market correction.

title: Cloudflare down latest: Websites such as Twitter not working amid technical problems with the internet
byline: Parts of the web appear to have stopped working amid a technical problem at Cloudflare.

title: NPP secures Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) secured control of the Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha today with the election of P.K. Premaratne as chairman, in a vote supervised by Western Province Local Government Commissioner Sarangika Jayasundara.

title: Namal criticizes Govt for ignoring professionals in 2026 budget planning
byline: National Organizer of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), Namal Rajapaksa, has criticized the government for disregarding the concerns of professionals and the public, following a meeting with the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA).

title: Trinco temple clash: ‘Don’t question clergy power’ – Gnanasara Thera
byline: Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) General Secretary Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera today issued a strong warning that the authority of the Buddhist clergy must not be challenged, following unrest in Trincomalee linked to the removal of a Buddha statue and an enforcement operation by the Coast Conservation Department.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa to join opposition rally in Nugegoda
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa is expected to take part in the rally in Nugegoda, organized  by opposition parties led by the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) on November 21.

title: New low pressure system may affect Northern Sri Lanka
byline: The Department of Meteorology has said that the current low pressure area over Sri Lanka is moving away, and its impact on the weather is gradually reducing.

title: Writ petition filed to prevent demolition at Trincomalee Buddhist temple
byline: The Chief Incumbent of the Sri Sambuddha Jayanthi Bodhiraja Viharaya in Trincomalee, Venerable Kalyanawansa Tissa Thera, has filed a writ petition before the Court of Appeal seeking an order to prevent the demolition of a section of the temple premises.

title: Easter Sunday attacks evidence destroyed, but govt will find mastermind: President
byline: Evidence related to the Easter Sunday attacks has been destroyed, but that will not stop the government from uncovering the truth behind the carnage, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake told Parliament today.
